info.abstract: The Gaming Tendency Estimate performs a logistic regression using the student ID as a random intercept while controlling for content type to infer the latent gaming tendency of the student.
info.description:
This component helps estimate the student's latent gaming tendency. A workflow demo for this component is provided in the following link.
This component takes transaction logs with gaming labels as input from the Session Level Features component (Transform > Session Level Features) and computes a single latent estimate for each individual student present in the dataset.

inputs.b: Student transaction logs with labels for inferred gaming. The gaming can be inferred using any gaming detector. The initial exploration was conducted using the rule-based gaming detector.

ul.li: A tab-delimited text file estimating the individual students' gaming tendency.
